results.title: The People's music: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Arch Nicholson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Russian Education”.
Contains eleven examples of Soviet citizens engaged in making music. Ranges from kindergarten children in Minst singing and dancing a traditional folk song to the highly respected professional group, the Kuban Cossack Choir and the Veryovka Folk Ensemble. Photographer, Dean Semler; script, Roger Milliss; editor, Martyn Down; sound, George Hart, Howard Spry; commentator, Margaret Throsby.

results.title: The People's diva: Joan Carden
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Christina Wilcox and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Creative Spirits Series”.
A delightful journey through the world of opera, this film is constructed around Joan Carden’s preparation and performance as Cio-Cio San in Puccini’s highly entertaining and accessible opera “Madam Butterfly”. Sequences of Carden preparing for that production are intercut with her preparation for the role of Musetta opposite Dame Kiri Te Kanawa’s Mimi in the Victoria State Opera’s “La Boheme”. Historical film shows notable performances from her past that firmly implanted her on the international scene. We see Carden as an actor and singer and she talks of the influences, techniques, demands and pitfalls that are part and parcel of her art.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Featherstone, Christina Wilcox and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The People's community: 1937-1941
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Hitler’s Germany”.
The most urgent problems facing Germany in the 1920’s and early 30’s were inflation, massive unemployment and political violence. This three part series is about how Adolf Hitler solved these problems and the rise of the Third Reich as told by the people who were there. Part 3, spans the period 1937 to 1941, and examines Hitler’s moves to unite Germany and restore its economy through the introduction of “Labour Camps” which saw rich and poor working together. Hitler’s ambition to make every German in Europe part of his Reich is witnessed. Through the invasion of Czechoslovakia, Poland and France, Germany was now master of Western Europe. With only the East to conquer, Hitler on June 22nd 1941, declared war on Russia.

results.title: The People's communes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
Uses scenes from three communes in different parts of China to show the range of work and activities carried on in communes. However, a clear picture of people’s rules within these communes and the structural organisation is not shown.

results.title: The People's choice
results.creator_credit: Edward Magruder Jones, Elspeth MacDougall and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made in the International Women’s Year, 1975, this film provides an overview of women politicians running for office in several South American countries. Also contains interviews with the general public about the attitudes towards women in politics. Narrated by Rita Moreno.

results.title: The People's army
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
An inside picture of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army - as well as being a fighting force, the army, in contrast to western peacetime armies, uses its personnel in “civilian” activities and is a training ground for politics, engineering and agriculture. Photographed, written and narrated by Felix Greene.

results.title: The Pentridge experience. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Abbott
results.brief_description: Examines problems of prison officers, both within the prison and outside. Also shows the difficulties faced by prisoners and their families through lack of facilities for contact visits. Includes a condemnation of the continued existence of H Division and its medieval labour yards. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Pentridge experience. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Chequerboard, Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Abbott
results.brief_description: Shows the grim conditions of the reception prison, where men awaiting trial are retained, and the classification process that convicted prisoners undergo. Interviews with prisoners discuss the lack of privacy and associated problems, and the new “term of natural life” sentence. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Penguins of Macquarie Island [B&W]
results.brief_description: Observes the habits of the various species of penguins which live on Macquarie Island. The film was compiled from record material photographed by members of the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition and officers of the CSIRO. The penguins are seen marching to and from their rookeries, assembling on the beach, looking after their young, and at play. Various features, which distinguish one species from another, are illustrated.
